description: Latin, from Ancient Greek κακοήθης (kakoḗthēs, “ill-disposed”) (κακός (kakós, “bad”) + ἦθος (êthos, “disposition, nature”))  +‎ -ic

adjectives.description: cacoethic (comparative more cacoethic, superlative most cacoethic)

entries.meaning: (medicine, obsolete) Of or pertaining to a cacoethes (a malignant tumour or ulcer).
